attributes.action: Provide urgent humanitarian aid to Southern Madagascar
attributes.background: International bodies are urgently calling for international support as over a million Madagascans go hungry, with some surviving on insects and wild roots. Show leadership and work with humanitarian organisations and the international community to deliver food supplies and halt this catastrophe.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change and COVID are exacerbating famine in Southern Madagascar, which is suffering its worst drought for 40 years. As child malnutrition rates have nearly doubled in just a few months, funding is urgently needed by humanitarian partners to avert a hunger catastrophe. Lives are at risk and children are suffering. In the worst affected areas, acute malnutrition has risen by 27%.

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

attributes.action: Ban trade deals with countries that deny climate change or not meeting targets.
attributes.background: To make it illegal to engage in the formation of international trade agreements with countries that either (a) deny the process and threat of climate change (b) refuse to ratify internationally agreed climate goals (e.g. Paris Agreement or Kyoto Protocol) or (c) are not working to meet those goals.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change is an existential threat to our world and to business as normal. Pursuing business as normal with countries that are not engaging positively with the impact of climate change will severely impact the well being of everyone and the GDP of all countries. It is irresponsible to reward and encourage countries that deny climate change or are not engaging with pollution reduction with trade deals. As the UK wants to be a global leader on climate change, these deals should not be made.

departments.name: Department for International Trade

attributes.action: Require food items to display information relating to their carbon footprint
attributes.background: The government should pass laws to make sure supermarkets and other food sellers publish clearly the carbon footprint of each item, including the air miles required. This should be done in a traffic light system in order to increase consumer awareness of the carbon footprint of our diets.
attributes.additional_details: With climate change becoming a significant threat to this planet, the government should implement this to allow consumers to shop in a more eco-friendly way by seeing the impact their purchases have on the planet. The aim is to encourage people to buy items that are grown locally, and to encourage people to pick produce that has travelled the fewest air miles.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Take action to tackle global deforestation
attributes.background: The Government should implement policies to seek to tackle global deforestation including carbon trading schemes, diplomatic measures to pressure foreign governments to tackle deforestation, and use of sanctions against governments involved in deforestation.
attributes.additional_details: Global deforestation is a major contributing factor to both global warming and climate change. Both of these are existential threats to our planet so we must take all possible steps to counter them.

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

attributes.action: End the freeze on fuel duty and raise it to match or exceed inflation
attributes.background:
The current freeze on fuel duty - of which 2021 is the eleventh consecutive year - should be abolished.

Fuel duty should be increased to match, or exceed, inflation over the past eleven years - in other words, it should be equal to or greater than what it would be had it never been frozen.
attributes.additional_details:
The predominant effect of the freeze is to keep the cost of petrol and diesel used in vehicles down. This reduces the incentive for motorists to switch to electric vehicles, & comparatively penalises users of public transport, who have still faced regular fare increases throughout the freeze.

In a time when climate change is a more serious issue than ever before, it is simply irresponsible of our government to adopt policies which discourage adoption of far more environmentally friendly modes of travel.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Require shops to have their lights switched off after closing
attributes.background: Many establishments still have lights or screens switched on after closing every day. This wastes electricity and causes more fossil fuels to be burned, which contributes to global warming. If the government were to force shops to switch off electronics overnight, this could be prevented.
attributes.additional_details: The continued use of electricity causes more fossil fuels to be burned—these produce greenhouse gases, which contribute to global warming. This causes climate change, which, if not acted on before 2030 (according to the UN Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change in 2018), will become irreversible, bringing about the end of life on Earth. This rule (above) would lead to a smaller amount of fossil fuels being burned, lessening the country’s carbon footprint and helping to prevent climate change.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Run Eat Responsibly campaign and require labels on meat, egg and dairy products
attributes.background: I am asking for an 'Eat Responsibly' campaign to be launched about consumption of meat, eggs and dairy products, similar to public awareness campaigns about responsible drinking. In addition, products containing meat, dairy and eggs should be required to display an 'Eat Responsibly' label.
attributes.additional_details: The animal agriculture industry is responsible for being one of the leading causes driving climate change and rising global temperatures. Scientific evidence shows the negative effects on the environment as well as public health that the meat and dairy industries and products have, whether that be in the form of zoonotic diseases, or the direct negative impact a heavily meat and dairy-based diet can have on an individual’s health, which in turn puts more strain on public health systems.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Save UK soil: increase soil organic matter to 3% by 2045 in agricultural land.
attributes.background: Save UK soil: Put policy to commit and put actions in place to increase soil organic matter content in agriculture to a minimum of 3% by 2045. I believe that this would prevent the significant risk of national and domestic food shortages that could occur from around 2065 onwards.
attributes.additional_details: Without this policy change I believe that there is significant risk of national and domestic food shortages occurring from around 2065 onwards, affecting many of our generation and the next. I believe that the policy has the potential to turn the tables on mitigating climate change and increasing ground water resources. This is a global movement supported by UNEP, WFP & UNCCD. It's an issue that without action is likely to negatively affect either us or our children if we don't take action.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools and workplaces to have recycling bins
attributes.background: Recycling saves energy as it reduces the need for extracting, refining and processing materials all of which create air & water pollution, and greenhouse gas emissions. Recycling can help tackle climate change, and schools and workplaces should be required to have recycling bins to help with this.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally, recycling is a diverse industry and when compared to waste disposal it is much more labour intensive. This means building the recycling industry is also a way to create more jobs. It is said that disposing of 10,000 tons of waste in a landfill creates six jobs, as opposed to recycling the same amount of waste, which creates 36 jobs. Overall, there are many benefits to be derived from recycling and schools and workplaces should be required to contribute to recycling.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy
Department for Education

attributes.action: Increase support for nuclear power to reduce reliance on fossil fuels
attributes.background: We need to open more, and keep open longer nuclear power plants to reduce our reliance on burning fossil fuels which contributes to global warming, while creating robust storage and systems for the processing of toxic waste. This would be a huge step in reducing our output of greenhouse gases.
attributes.additional_details: Nuclear power has caused relatively few deaths in comparison with the most conservative estimates of the respiratory illness and other impacts of climate change on humans. If we replace fossil fuels, this should help slow global warming and mitigate its impacts. Nuclear power is statistically much safer than many people believe and it should be exploited fully to fulfil our responsibility to take care of the Earth for future generations.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Change the law on airport slots to favour ecological practices
attributes.background:
Under international guidelines and EU law companies keep their landing slots if they use them over 80% of the time in UK's major airports.

During the covid-19 crisis this is resulting in ghost (empty) flights.
attributes.additional_details:
UK law should priorities positive ecological practices both during and post the crisis.
 
The House of Commons has announced a climate change emergency.
 
Aircraft engines emit particulates and gases into the atmosphere which contributes to climate change.
In times of low international travel (such as now, during covid-19 outbreak) planes should not fly empty.
 
Laws such as the 80% slot usage leads to economical incentive for airlines to fly empty planes because slots are valuable. This practice should be stopped. The priority should be to reduce pollution not support big airlines.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Fund global climate change mitigation and give displaced people refugee status
attributes.background:
Environmental refugees should have the same legal rights as refugees of conflict and persecution, including a legal right to stay.
The UK government should provide support for adaptation and mitigation measures in developing nations to preemptively minimise displacement.
attributes.additional_details:
Providing developing countries with the money they need to make crucial adaptations to climate change and other environmental challenges is essential.
As climate change is already affecting communities all over the world, including right here in the UK, we need to ensure there is a legal and policy framework in place to protect climate refugees.
Estimates suggest there are already more than 40 million environmental refugees, action must be taken now as this will increase in the years to come.

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office
Home Office

attributes.action: Fund replanting of trees lost to forest fires to help combat climate change
attributes.background: The Government should ensure there is sufficient funding and support to areas affected by the recent wildfires to allow sufficient trees to be replanted.
attributes.additional_details: It is important these areas are replenished to support local wildlife who may have been displaced or injured due to the ongoing wildfires. It is also important to offset global emissions produced by the United Kingdom and replanting forests can be a big part of a viable solution.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Make heat pump installations mandatory on all new buildings.
attributes.background: It is pointless to continue gas central heating installations if the Government is going to have to spend money changing to heat pumps in the next ten years.
attributes.additional_details: Global Climate Change is an existential threat, and cannot be put off until "The Time is Right".

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Increase funding for coastal defence and compensate owners for lost properties
attributes.background: The Government should increase funding for sea defences to protect vulnerable homes, and compensate owners for losses incurred for land and property lost to the sea because of erosion exacerbated by rising sea levels created by climate change.
attributes.additional_details: Coastal Erosion is putting many homes at risk, including 22 at Skipsea Sands, and shoreline management plans do not protect all of these. Homeowners whose properties are affected can face eviction and be required to pay for the demolition of their properties, without any compensation.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Implement the proposed ban on new petrol and diesel car sales from 2030
attributes.background: The Government have proposed banning sales of new fossil-fuel powered cars from 2030. That's a necessary and achievable step against the climate crisis. Many drivers who have switched to an electric vehicle, or are considering doing so, wish to show their support for this.
attributes.additional_details:
Banning new ICE car sales from 2030 will not force anyone to scrap an older or classic car overnight.
 
At least one petition opposing this sensible change is live, and is based on the flawed argument that "electric cars are nowhere near as economic as diesel and petrol cars".
 
The signatories of this petition want to express support for a proposal that is sensible, reasonable and desperately needed as a step towards a sustainable climate.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Require rainwater recovery for new builds and offer grants for older properties
attributes.background: The Government should require that all new builds have underground rainwater recovery systems installed. A grant scheme should also be set up. This could be funded by additional taxes on underperforming water companies, to help homeowners to retrofit on existing properties.
attributes.additional_details:
We're going to see more hosepipe bans and water shortages every year due to a range of factors:

Circa 175k new properties being built every year, with the Government plan to increase to 300K

No new reservoirs built in 30 years

Climate change is causing hotter, drier summers

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the burning of peatlands in the fight against climate change.
attributes.background: The UK’s peatlands store more than 3000 million tons of carbon. Burning peatlands for grouse shooting releases CO2 into the atmosphere adding to the climate crisis and further degrading this important habitat making it less capable of further carbon capture.
attributes.additional_details: By banning the burning of peatlands not only is CO2 not being released into the atmosphere from fires but the habitat is able to recover and become a more powerful, natural carbon sink. Peatlands also support a range of native species so their protection increases biodiversity.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Nationalise all Public Transport and make it free to all to help climate change
attributes.background: The Government needs to nationalise public transport to help the climate crisis. Make public transport owned by the Government, and free to use for all.
attributes.additional_details: This needs to happen because a lot of people refuse to pay the unnecessarily expensive price to use the bus or train, and instead use their cars. If more people use public transport, less people will use their cars which will help to significantly reduce our country’s carbon footprint.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Make cars with high emissions have red number plates.
attributes.background: The effects of high emitting vehicles on the climate should be publicised, particularly SUVs.
attributes.additional_details: To inform the public of how everyday activities are changing the climate.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Make working from home a legal right to help cut co2 emissions.
attributes.background: Make it a legal right for employees to work from home if viable for them to do so with  office working only when there is a business need.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change is effecting us all, we need to cut co2 output & cutting out unnecessary commutes to work would help cut millions of tons every year. If you can work at home the same way as at work then it should be law to do so.

departments.name: Department for Work and Pensions

attributes.action: Tax disposable nappies & use the money to give parents a reusables starter kit.
attributes.background: Disposable nappies are currently zero rated for VAT. If instead a tax were added and the money raised used to fund a reusable starter pack of nappies for babies in the UK this could encourage parents to use reusable nappies thereby reducing landfill, ocean plastics and climate change.
attributes.additional_details: The UK disposes of 3 billion disposable nappies each year, which represents an estimated 2-3% of all household waste. It is estimated a single baby uses between 4000 and 6000 nappies by the time they are potty trained. The majority of these nappies are not biodegradable and are placed into household waste so go into landfill which is a major environmental concern. We urgently need action to address climate change and this could massively reduce landfill and encourage more sustainability.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Remove VAT on loft insulation
attributes.background: The average semi detached house needs 16 rolls of insulation material 200 mm thick, to bring any existing 70 mm insulation up to current building standards. The 20% VAT on 16 rolls of insulation typically exceeds £200. This petition calls for the removal of all VAT from insulation materials.
attributes.additional_details: At a time of inflated energy costs and the threats caused by climate change. Householders need help and encouragement to take affordable steps to reduce the burden on the nation's energy needs. To add 20% to the cost of home insulation is unhelpful, discouraging and nonsensical.

attributes.action: Plant one native tree for each UK resident to commemorate the Queen’s Jubilee.
attributes.background: To commemorate the Queen’s Jubilee the UK Government should provide resources for a tree planting programme to plant a native tree for each UK resident (at least 5% to be oak, beech or elm) in a patchwork across England.
attributes.additional_details: As a fitting and long lasting tribute to the Queen for decades of service to the country, to benefit the national environment, assist in the battle against climate change and to foster enthusiasm across the country for planting trees.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Create laws for what can/cant be classed as sustainable to prevent greenwashing
attributes.background: I would like the government to take action and design laws that lay out clear definitions for what can/cant be classed as sustainable that companies will have to meet before claiming to be sustainable. This is so that consumers can make informed choices when shopping and to prevent greenwashing.
attributes.additional_details:
Greenwashing is rife in brand campaigns, climate change is on a lot of peoples minds and consumers want to make choices when shopping that are better for the planet however when brands claim to be sustainable with no guidelines, rules or laws to regulate what can and cant be classed as sustainable they are misleading consumers with buzzwords. 

The government should take the leading steps to create these laws so we can protect both the planet and consumers from making misinformed decisions.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Invest in new nuclear and renewable generation to replace fossil fuels
attributes.background: This petition calls for investment in a hybrid system of renewable energy (solar panels and wind turbines) with nuclear power plants, to be built on a national scale. This will combine the advantages of both to help make a real difference to the climate crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
40°C is not a normal temperature for the UK, yet it happened this July. If we don't act now, climate change will only get worse.

An effective way to tackle this it is to transform the way we produce electricity. Scientific advancements have made it possible to phase out non-renewables: renewable energy is cheaper (than non-renewables) and easy to build on a large scale but are less reliable. As nuclear plants are both safe and reliable, a hybrid system of both should help cut down greenhouse emissions.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Establish a National Tree Planting Scheme
attributes.background: The Government should establish a scheme to plant trees on a national scale, in order to try and stop the effects of climate change. By planting trees, and perhaps even whole forests, we may be able to release more oxygen and absorb more carbon dioxide.
attributes.additional_details: The reasoning behind this is to try and help the planet, one step at a time. The amount of trees cut down each year is ridiculous and terrible. If we continue to plant trees, we may be able to help with this issue.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Increase tax on private flights
attributes.background: Significantly increase taxes on private flights, to discourage use of private flights and to encourage use of more sustainable and less environmentally damaging modes of transport.
attributes.additional_details: Do this to help protect the environment by  promoting positive behaviour to reduce carbon emissions to address the climate change emergency.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Regulate the bike market and require frame number checks at repair.
attributes.background: The Government should regulate the bike market by requiring bikes to have a unique frame number, and sold bikes to have their ownership registered. All bike repairs should be required to log frame numbers and not return the bike if stolen. These initiatives should dramatically reduce bike crime.
attributes.additional_details: 376,000 Bikes are stolen each year in the UK, or one bike every 90 seconds. In 2019 thefts were up 49% on the previous year and this trend shows no signs of stopping. These thefts have got to stop. Bikes are becoming increasingly important, both immediately due to the coronavirus but also due to climate change and the governments efforts to get more people cycling to work.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: bring forward the deadline set by the 2008 Climate change act from 2050 to 2030
attributes.background: The 2008 Climate Change Act states that there must be a reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 100% from the 1990 levels by 2050. this time scale is to long as the damage from climate change will be irreversible by this date.
attributes.additional_details: Bringing forward the deadline to 2030 would force the government to create change.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make ‘Environmental Education’ a compulsory separate subject in all schools.
attributes.background: Climate Change is now in full flow and we need to ensure that schools are covering this issue separately from other subjects. It is currently taught in small chunks and deserves prominence as the biggest issue affecting our planet right now.
attributes.additional_details: It is obvious that ‘Environmental Education’ needs to be a distinct subject, rather than being scattered across the Geography and Science curriculum. It is taught in a varied way and much of the content is optional and so it should be made a compulsory subject.

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Ban private jets from UK airspace
attributes.background: The UK government needs to implement legislation to ban private jets from UK air spaces. People should not be allowed to ruin all of our collective efforts against climate change just for their own convenience.
attributes.additional_details: We are all in the climate crisis together and we all need to feel like we are in it together. One of the most disillusioning thing is to see the rich and privileged live by separate rules to the rest of us. Seeing your individual efforts made redundant by just one flight by someone using a private jet can be a huge disincentive to act on a personal level. We cannot allow a handful of individuals to damage our fight for our planet just so they can skip airport queues and avoid sitting next to the rest of us on a plane.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable BBQs and campfires on moorland
attributes.background: Make the use of disposable BBQs and campfires illegal on moorland in order to avoid devastating wildfires. Marsden Moor is not alone in seeing a number of huge wildfires over the last three years caused by the use of disposable bbqs, firecrackers and campfires.
attributes.additional_details: Wildfires are one of the biggest threats to our Moorland. Climate change, irresponsible behaviour and the use of disposable bbqs have led to an increase in these distressing events. Firefighters and volunteers are being asked to risk their lives to battle these fires in terrifying conditions and local communities are seeing their environment being destroyed Our wildlife is being devastated. Nesting birds are being forced to abandon their eggs and mass habitat destruction is occurring.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Establish a cross-party commission to agree set UK climate goals and actions
attributes.background: Create a commission with members of all the main political parties to set ambitious targets and agree policies to combat climate change and ensure the UK meets and exceeds the agreements at Paris. These should be made legally binding, with cross-party oversight for accountability.
attributes.additional_details: The challenges of climate change mean that what must often need to be done is very difficult because of the political ramifications to any given party. Therefore ambitious or disruptive policy is difficult to embed for fear of displeasing potential voters. Collectively agreeing a set of legally binding outcomes across parties, that any party in government is responsible for delivering, and overseen by all parties, removes the political barriers to effective action.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban carrier bags from public display in supermarkets
attributes.background: Carrier bag sales have fallen dramatically in recent years, but wastage continues while the world is at a pivotal moment in the fight against Climate Change, and we should do all we can to deter demand from overusing plastic items, i.e. carrier bags, through the hiding of bags from sight in stores.
attributes.additional_details: Hiding carrier bags from sight in stores could have the same effect as removing cigarettes from sight, reducing the demand from consumers to acquire a carrier bag to help shopping when perhaps they do not really require one. This could dramatically reduce plastic usage and help put humanity back on track to control Climate Change.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban petrol and diesel vehicles to keep our as air clean as it is now
attributes.background: End the production and use of petroleum powered vehicles on all UK roads. Only allow electric vehicles to be used on the roads by all private drivers & with severe restrictions on commercial use until enough electric commercial vehicles can be produced.
attributes.additional_details: Since the lockdown, air quality around the world has been the best it’s been in a century. Effects of climate change may be reversing across the planet. We the people refuse for it to go back to the catastrophic path we were going down prior to this global event. We want to breathe clean air, as is our birthright. We do not accept the poisoning of our bodies and the destruction of our planet to make a few people rich. End the use of fossil fuel powered vehicles on our roads immediately.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Ban energy-wasting open fridges and freezers in all retail outlets
attributes.background: Retailers in the United Kingdom unnecessarily waste huge amounts of energy on open fridges and freezers. Climate change threatens our planet. If all supermarkets had doors on their fridges and freezers it could save energy the equivalent of the entire residential population of Poland

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Set up a task force to consider how the UK could thrive in a warmer climate
attributes.background: To urgently set up a task force to identify actions that could enable the UK to thrive in a warmer climate, so these can then be implemented. Measures could include increased water storage and additional investment in dealing with rising sea levels.
attributes.additional_details: We know the climate is changing and this is going to impact on all aspects of life around the world. If we don't start to take steps now to mitigate these effects, life in the UK (particularly in the south) may be very uncomfortable. At the moment the focus seems to be on trying to reduce CO2 emissions enough to solve the problem. We believe this is insufficient, and a prudent government should plan in advance and not wait to the last minute.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Form a National Unity government, to tackle the ongoing Climate Emergency.
attributes.background:
I want the government to form a National Unity government composed of MPs from all parties, plus independents. The Climate Emergency has to be addressed by us all, working together. 

Our government has to be non-partisan, to help ensure that effective solutions can be implemented.
attributes.additional_details:
This follows the House of Commons declaration of a climate change emergency, in May 2019. It seems that the government has yet to declare a Climate Emergency as such however, or even a Crisis.

A UK National Unity government was last formed when the we faced an existential crisis, during wartime. We may well be facing much greater threats now: food, water, shelter, flooding, heat waves, and severe winter weather etc. Possibly even complete economic and social collapse.

departments.name: Office of the Leader of the House of Commons

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to report all direct and indirect emissions
attributes.background: The Government should make it mandatory for all companies to measure and report all direct and indirect greenhouse gas emissions, including emissions in the supply chain and upstream and downstream of the business.
attributes.additional_details: To tackle climate change and have transparent publication of emissions, so we can debate what practices should be retained and any trade offs that need to be made.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Require local authorities provide free recycling services for schools
attributes.background: It should be compulsory for all local authorities in England to provide schools with free plastic, metal, and paper recycling services. Too many schools are sending their recyclable waste to landfill along with their general waste, because they do not have access to free recycling services.
attributes.additional_details: According to Flexible Storage Solutions, the average primary school student in produces about 45kg of waste per year, and the average secondary school student is responsible for 22kg. The Department of Education's Sustainability and Climate Change strategy outlines that by 2025, it will eradicate single-use plastics, and encourage the use of reusable and recyclable materials in schools, but if schools don't have access to free recycling services, we believe this target will not be met.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Invest in hydrogen fuelling stations AND hydrogen fuel cell car manufacturers
attributes.background: Government need to invest in creating more fuelling stations with hydrogen capabilities as well as invest in UK based car manufacturers to create more HFC vehicles. Reducing the number fossil fuel powered cars on the road will reduce our CO² emissions to help the UK meet our climate targets.
attributes.additional_details: Climate change is a crisis, one that can and should have been averted by now. Inaction on this matter is going to cause global devastation of crops, record breaking droughts year on year which will eventually lead to mass migrations of refugees. To have a chance to prevent this, we need to switch to greener energy solutions, one of which being Hydrogen Fuel Cell vehicles which have been thoroughly safety tested.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Increase UK Govt Aid for Pakistan Flood Relief To £200 Million
attributes.background:
In Pakistan we are seeing the most serious and catastrophic impact of the climate change with 1/3rd Pakistan flooded, 1236 confirmed dead, 40 million people affected and 1 million homes destroyed. 

The UK Govt must announce £200 million aid in response to the unprecedented crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Foreign Office initially pledged £1.5 million to Pakistan's emergency relief efforts, that amounted to less than 5p for each person affected by the unprecedented floods. 

Today, UK stepped up support for Pakistan by announcing further £15 million. 

The UK Government announced £150 m support in the 2010 floods. The 2022 floods are much worse while less than 10% is being done compared to 2010. Pakistan is submerged, and we must act fast by announcing £200 million in aid to the relief efforts.

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

attributes.action: Stronger Legal Framework to Ensure Carbon Neutrality Targets
attributes.background: The Climate Change Act 2008 should be updated to put our promises of finance for developing countries into law along with allocating more money to climate technology and reducing reliance on fossil fuels. Companies should also be legally mandated to follow carbon neutral targets.
attributes.additional_details: With COP26 happening, the challenge to our way of life and the planet has never been so pressing. The calamity of the status quo has forced even our monarchy, usually the most neutral institution, to declare that we must adopt a "war-like footing". Despite talking ambitiously the government is currently overpromising and underdelivering with experts fearing that our current strategy means we are unlikely to reach our goals.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban business premises from leaving lights on after 11pm unnecessarily
attributes.background: Implement a lighting ban after 11pm on businesses that don't operate in the late hours. The ban should be enforced by issuing fines for businesses that don’t comply with the new rules, with all proceeds going directly to combating climate change.
attributes.additional_details: Large scale business premises that leave their lighting on 24:7 undermine the individual attempts to reverse climate change, as the energy they waste is on such a vast scale the efforts of the individual is consequently nullified. It is highly irresponsible and unnecessary for corporations to waste large amounts of energy by leaving lights on for such obscene lengths of time.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Fund a Lunar colony.
attributes.background: Fund and build one or more self-sustainable human outposts on the Earth's moon to act as a staging location for future colonisation of solar system as well as harvesters of Thorium and Helium-3 fuel sources which are abundant on the moon and can be used in Thorium (LFTR) and nuclear fusion reactors.
attributes.additional_details:
With climate change increasing the need for nuclear power as a primary energy source, this government is already investigating modern reactors which use Thorium to increase efficiency, and fusion and LFTR reactors, while still in the early stages of adoption offer greater gains which would justify this course of action in 50 years.

A more human justification is simply that this is the next logical step for our civilisation, and shows that we have faith in our collective futures in the universe.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Immediate ban on the use of diesel cars and make all public transport free
attributes.background: I want an immediate ban on Diesel engines in the United Kingdom and for public transport to become free.
attributes.additional_details: I want Diesel engines to be banned because they are polluting our earths atmosphere and I think that individual action will not be enough to turn climate change around. Although it may cause some inconvenience there is no point in using the Diesel engines because they are damaging the environment. If you agree me please sign this to create a better earth for our future generations.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Working class single parents need help! NOW
attributes.background:
I want the goverment to understand that working single parents literally can not afford to survive and can not afford to give our children a life they deserve. Please look at us who do not claim benefits but who pay TAX through working every hour just to get by! 
We need help and we need help now!
attributes.additional_details:
There must be payments that can be offered to support EVERYONE! 

I want single parents to be recognised and financial help offered to them if they are working and raising a child, child benefit is so small it barely contributes to anything let alone benefiting a child in the current climate. 
We need to put food on tables without worrying!

Things must change for our childrens futures!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the finances of working families, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we can accept petitions calling to changes to taxes and benefits, or entitlements to childcare.

attributes.action: SAVE BANGLADESH
attributes.background: Pledge Emergency aid and support to victims of extreme flooding in Bangladesh - a key exporter of clothing bringing billions to UK economy. Victims will require support with locating their families, accessing clean drinking water, emergency rehousing, food, clothes, medical treatment and relocating.
attributes.additional_details: Bangladesh is the leader in garment manufacturing and it boosts the UK economy. H&M, Boohoo, ASOS, ZARA, Gap all use Bangladeshi factories to produce their clothes. We must support them through this environmental & humanitarian crisis caused by climate change and global warming. We rely on Bangladesh for its affordable labour and it is in our best interests to save this country from going under water. Bangladesh is projected to become a low-middle income country by 2026 and is tackling poverty.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action:  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618691

attributes.action: Petition the Government on energy prices
attributes.background: I want the government to take action on the huge increases in commercial energy prices.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Put a cap on commercial energy rates
2. Just putting a cap is not going to be enough so a fund needs to be set up by the government to help small businesses. The proceeds from this fund will be accessed directly by energy companies enabling them to include a credit on each bill issued to sme's much in the same way as the climate change levy is currently added to energy invoices.
3. The total effect of the above action should be that sme's energy costs are not impacted by more than 10% this year and not more than the inflation rate from next year.
Taking the above action is necessary and will ensure the survival of many small businesses.
